page.title: 17Life of a soldier's child.
page.content: There are two{army barracks}in Windsor and the{soldiers' families}live in West Windsor. If your father is in the army, you live in all sorts of different places. { I was born}on 29th June 1976, in Aldershot Military Hospital. My daddy is a sergeant in the 1st Battalion Grenadier Guards. He guards Windsor Castle, Buckingham Palace, St. James' Palace and the Tower of London. We will be going to live in{Munster, {West Germany}in February 1986. We have lived in{Berlin}and we used to visit {East Berlin.}You need an identity card to go there because of the wall that separates East from West. It is called the{Berlin Wall.}In East Berlin we visited{Trepton Park,}where many Russian soldiers, who died in the war, are buried.
